item.title: He Refused to Become a Jailhouse Snitch. Can He Stop David Wood’s Execution?
item.description: Texas plans to execute Wood in March. George Hall says police encouraged him to lie about Wood confessing six murders to him.

item.title: Carroll Bogert Steps Down as President of The Marshall Project
item.description: Under her tenure, the organization saw robust growth, developed news products for incarcerated audiences, and expanded into three cities.

item.title: How a Guards’ Strike Plunged New York Prisons Into Turmoil and Why the Timing Is Curious
item.description: Correctional officers complain of unsafe conditions, but critics say the protests were meant to deflect attention from ‘a moment of reckoning.’

item.title: ‘Fear for Their Lives’: Trans Women Federal Prisoners Told They Will Be Housed With Men
item.description: After a minor change in a judge’s order, the Trump administration arranged to move over a dozen transgender women to men’s facilities.

item.title: FBI Subpoena Targets How Cuyahoga County Judge Leslie Celebrezze Steered Work to Friend
item.description: The grand jury subpoena also focuses on Mark Dottore’s company, which has earned more than $500,000 in fees from the court since 2017.
